tit.e: Kanjoginmiyaku (a governmental post in the Edo period)
Kanjoginmiyaku (a governmental post in the Edo period)
Kanjoginmiyaku (a governmental post in the Edo period)

sen.j: 勘定吟味役（かんじょうぎんみやく）は、江戸幕府において、勘定所の職務すべてを監査を担当した役職である。
sen.e: Kanjoginmiyaku was a governmental post whose officers were in charge of auditing all jobs in the Kanjo-sho office (the office for finance).
Kanjoginmiyaku was a governmental post in charge of auditing all jobs in the Kanjo-sho office (the office for finance) in the Edo Bakufu.
sen.cmt: より自然な流れにするため以下のように変更しました。whose officers were →削除「江戸幕府において」訳漏れのため、最後にin the Edo Shogunateを追加しました。
sen.e: Kanjoginmiyaku was a governmental post in charge of auditing all jobs in the Kanjo-sho office (the office for finance) in the Edo Bakufu.

sen.j: 勘定吟味役は、勘定所に設置され、旗本・御家人から起用された。
sen.e: Kanjoginmiyaku was located at the Kanjo-sho office, and the officers were appointed from Hatamoto (direct retainers of the bakufu, which わs a form of Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) or Gokenin (also direct retainers of the bakufu, but lower-ranked than Hatamoto).

Kanjoginmiyaku was installed at the Kanjo-sho office, and the officers were appointed from Hatamoto (direct retainers of the bakufu) or Gokenin (also direct retainers of the bakufu, but lower-ranked than Hatamoto).
sen.cmt: より自然にするため変更しました。located→installed今更bakufuの説明は不要なので、以下削除。(, which waｓ a form of Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun)
sen.e: Kanjoginmiyaku was installed at the Kanjo-sho office, and the officers were appointed from Hatamoto (direct retainers of the bakufu) or Gokenin (also direct retainers of the bakufu, but lower-ranked than Hatamoto).

sen.j: 勘定所内では勘定奉行に次ぐ地位であったが、勘定奉行の次席ではなく老中直属の機関である。
sen.e: Though being ranked next to the Kanjo-bugyo post in the Kanjo-sho office, this post was not under the Kanjo-bugyo post but belonged directly to Roju (the second-highest post in the Bakufu government).

Though being ranked next to the Kanjo-bugyo post in the Kanjo-sho office, this post was not under the Kanjo-bugyo post but under Roju's direct supervision (the second-highest post in the Bakufu government).
sen.cmt: より自然な流れにするため、belonged directly to → under Roju's direct supervision
sen.e: Though being ranked next to the Kanjo-bugyo post in the Kanjo-sho office, this post was not under the Kanjo-bugyo post but under Roju's direct supervision (the second-highest post in the Bakufu government).

sen.j: 御定員数（おさだめいんずう、定員）は4～6名。
sen.e: Osadame-inzu (the number of officers) was four to six.
Osadame-inzu (the number of officers) was four to six.
Osadame-inzu (the number of officers) was four to six.

sen.j: 格式石高500石、他に役料（職務手当）300俵。
sen.e: Each of the officers was given a 500 koku of rice crop (approx. 180 liters/koku) for its rank status and 300 straw bags of rice crop for its job.
Each of the officers was given a 500 koku of rice crop (approx. 180 liters/koku) for its rank status and 300 straw bags of rice crop for its job.
Each of the officers was given a 500 koku of rice crop (approx. 180 liters/koku) for its rank status and 300 straw bags of rice crop for its job.

sen.j: 平素は江戸城の中の間（なかのま）に詰めた。
sen.e: Ordinarily, the officers waited in the Nakano-ma room.
Ordinarily, the officers waited in the Nakano-ma room.
Ordinarily, the officers waited in the Nakano-ma room.

sen.j: 勘定所は、幕府財政の収支、天領での年貢徴収、長崎貿易、郡代・代官の勤怠、貨幣改鋳など財政に関する事務一切を扱った。
sen.e: The Kanjo-sho office dealt with all finance-related matters, including the balance of the bakufu's finance, the collection of tax in Tenryo (the areas controlled directly by the bakufu), trade at Nagasaki, the work statuses of the Gundai officers and of the Daikan officers, and reminting coins.

sen.j: 勘定吟味役はこれら職務すべてを監査した。
sen.e: Kanjoginmiyaku officers audited all of these jobs.

sen.j: 財政支出を決定する際には必ず勘定吟味役の賛同を要した。
sen.e: Any financial expenditure had to be supported by the Kanjoginmiyaku officers.
Any financial expenditure had to be supported by the Kanjoginmiyaku officers.

sen.j: 老中直属であるから、勘定奉行を含め勘定所下僚に不正があった場合、直ちに老中に報告する権限を有していた。
sen.e: Because being belonged directly to Roju, the officers had the authority of informing Rouj immediately of the wrong acts done by officers in the Kanjo-sho office, including Kanjo-bugyo officers.

Since it was directly under the control of Roju, the officers had the authority of informing Rouj immediately of the wrong acts done by officers in the Kanjo-sho office, including Kanjo-bugyo officers.

sen.j: はじめ徳川綱吉が設置し、元禄期に荻原重秀が独断で廃止してしまったが、新井白石が再度設置。
sen.e: This post, initially established by Tsunayoshi TOKUGAWA, was once abolished by Shigehide OGIWARA at his own discretion in the Genroku era (1688 - 17-4)), but was restored by Hakuseki ARAI.

sen.j: 享保期に財政担当と訴訟担当の吟味役に分離された。
sen.e: In the Kyoho era (1716 - 1736), the post was separated into Ginmi-yaku (audit post) for financial affairs and Ginmi-yaku for law suits.

sen.j: その後宝暦期には徳川家重の下命により、直属の部下13名をつけられ、独立した検査監査機構としての体制が整った。
sen.e: Later, in the Horeki era (1751 - 1764), 13 subordinates were placed under each of these officer according to an order from Ieshige TOKUGAWA, establishing the system as an independent inspection and audit organization.

sen.j: 幕臣は勘定吟味役になると、六位となり布衣が許される。
sen.e: When a baku-shin (a direct retainer of the bakufu) became a Kanjoginmiyaku officer, he was ranked at Rokui (the sixth rank), being allowed to wear clothes called Hoi.

sen.j: 享保の改革で足高の制ができて以降、下級幕吏が到達できるほぼ最高のポストとなり、これ以上の昇格は非常にまれとなる。
sen.e: After the Ashidakanosei law was enacted in the Kyoho reforms, this post was the highest one that could be reached by lower-class officers of the bakufu, and it was rare that such an officer was promoted above this post.
